isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR CONDITIONER (EVAPORATOR) HOUSING

svcprocinfo.para: Removal and installation of the evaporator housing requires the removal of other assemblies (such as right splash panel, cab cowl tray, and/or air filter). The assemblies that must be removed vary by vehicle model and engine combinations. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

item.para: The cab cowl tray exists in several variations. Refer to the appropriate CAB Section in Group 16 of the Master Service Manual for procedures covering cowl drain trays.
For most other under hood assemblies that may require removal, refer to the appropriate section in GROUP 09 of the Master Service Manual.

note.para: If you were referenced to this procedure from the heater housing removal procedure; note that on some vehicles it may be possible to unmount the evaporator housing and move it away from the cowl enough to remove the heater housing mounting nuts (located behind the evaporator housing), WITHOUT disconnecting the A/C lines. Inspect the vehicle being serviced and review the following procedure to determine if complete removal of the evaporator housing is necessary. If it is determined that disconnection of the A/C lines is unnecessary, review the following procedures and perform only the steps required to remove the evaporator housing from the cowl. If this method is followed, it will still be necessary to unclamp A/C lines to allow movement. When positioning the evaporator housing out of the way DO NOT kink the A/C lines.

step1.para: If necessary, remove right side splash panel.
Remove cab cowl tray.

If air cleaner mounting bracket surrounds evaporator housing, air cleaner and mounting bracket must be removed from cowl. If air cleaner and mounting bracket do not block access to evaporator housing, proceed to next step.

step2.para: Disconnect air tube and all electrical wiring from engine air cleaner housing. Cover engine air intake to prevent dirt or debris from entering system.
Disconnect electrical connections to any components mounted to the air cleaner mounting bracket.
Remove engine air cleaner from its mounting bracket.
Remove air cleaner mounting bracket from cowl.

step1.para: Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
Disconnect wiring to thermistors (2 and 5, Figure 24) and remove strap locks, as necessary, to allow connectors to be moved out of the way.
Unclip or remove clamps securing condenser-to-evaporator line (10) to evaporator housing (9).
Disconnect end of condenser-to-evaporator line from filter-drier (6).
Unclip clamps and/or strap locks securing evaporator-to-compressor line (7) to cowl.
Disconnect end of evaporator-to-compressor line from outlet thermistor line (5).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Evaporator Housing (Shown with Cowl Tray Removed)

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. EVAPORATOR OUTLET LINE (INCLUDES LOW SIDE SERVICE PORT)

step1.para: Disconnect wiring connector to actuator motor for fresh/recirc air door (16, Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Evaporator Housing Mounting and Components

step1.para: Remove four nuts securing evaporator housing (12, Figure 25) to mounting studs on cowl.
Carefully remove evaporator housing from cowl.

important.para: The need to perform additional steps is determined by the specific repair being performed. Perform only the following steps that are required to transfer parts to a replacement housing or to replace parts within the removed housing.

step1.para: To remove recirc door actuator (16, Figure 25), remove two screws securing actuator to evaporator housing (12).
Remove drain tubes (17, Figure 25) from evaporator housing.
Remove filter-drier, expansion valve, and associated a/c lines, as an assembly (Figure 26), as follows.

step2.para: Remove screw securing filter-drier inlet line clamp to evaporator housing.
Remove nuts securing evaporator inlet and outlet lines (1 and 10, Figure 25) to the evaporator core inlet and outlet fittings.
While supporting filter-drier (11, Figure 25), remove two mounting bolts (19) securing filter-drier to evaporator housing.

caution.para: While separating evaporator housing be careful not to damage fins or fittings on evaporator core.

note.para: The housing halves normally snap together and are secured with one screw (hi-lo thread); however, mounting tabs are provided to allow assembling the halves with additional hi-lo thread screws if the plastic snaps are damaged during disassembly. The mounting tabs are designed specifically to use only hi-lo thread screws.

step1.para: Separate housing halves by removing one or more hi-lo thread screws, releasing snap tabs, and pulling halves straight away from each other.
Remove and discard mounting gaskets (13 and 14, Figure 25) if they are damaged during separation.
With housing separated, the evaporator core and/or fresh/recirculate air door may be removed.

important.para: When replacing a damaged fresh/recirc air door verify that no parts remain lodged in the housing or evaporator core.

step1.para: When replacing a damaged evaporator housing (or housing half), transfer all good components (evaporator core, fresh/recirculate door, door actuator, and drain tubes) from the damaged housing to the new housing.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Filter-Drier, Expansion Valve, and Associated A/C Lines

note.para: Depending on the level of disassembly required for the repair, some of the following steps may not be necessary for each installation.

step1.para:
If refrigerant system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before reassembling the system. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.

When installing a new evaporator housing or reinstalling a housing that was removed for service, verify that all internal components (evaporator core and fresh/recirculate door) are installed in the housing before joining the housing halves.

note.para: The housing halves normally snap together and are secured with one screw (hi-lo thread); however, mounting tabs are provided to allow assembling the halves with additional hi-lo thread screws if the plastic snaps are damaged during disassembly. The mounting tabs are designed specifically to use only hi-lo thread screws.

step1.para: Join housing halves by using snap tabs and one screw. If any snap tabs have been damaged, use additional hi-lo thread screws in the molded joining tabs to securely join housing halves.

caution.para: In the following step, never force the actuator drive collar into position. If the drive collar position must be changed, perform the following procedures. Forcing the drive collar may result in a broken actuator.

step1.para: If fresh/recirculate air door actuator (16, Figure 25), was previously removed, install actuator by rotating door until flats on door shaft align with actuator hub, if possible. If actuator drive collar must be moved to allow alignment:

step2.para: Place actuator into its approximate position.
Connect a 9 Volt battery across pins A and F of actuator connector, to rotate drive collar. (Reverse connection to rotate drive collar in opposite direction.)
Allow drive collar to rotate until it is aligned with door shaft, and actuator mounting screws can be inserted. Then, disconnect battery.

step1.para: Secure actuator to evaporator housing with two screws.
Install drain tubes (17, Figure 25).
Using a new gasket/seal (14, Figure 25), install evaporator housing (12) onto mounting studs located on cowl using four nuts. Tighten to 5,400 to 7,600 N.mm (47.5 to 67.5 lbf-in).

caution.para: In the following steps the filter-drier, expansion valve, and their associated a/c lines are treated as an assembly. When installing this assembly care must be taken to align connections properly and to not place undue stress on a/c line connections. Once the filter-drier mounting bolts are loosely installed to support the assembly, the a/c line connections should be torqued to provide proper joining and alignment, before tightening the filter-drier mounting bolts.

note.para: Always lubricate O-rings on fittings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: Place new O-rings and C-plates on evaporator inlet and outlet lines (1 and 10, Figure 25).

Place filter-drier/expansion valve assembly (Figure 26) into its approximate position by inserting evaporator inlet and outlet lines into evaporator core inlet and outlet fittings; AND loosely installing the two filter-drier mounting bolts (19, Figure 25). (Filter-drier mounting bolts must be loose enough to allow proper alignment of evaporator inlet and outlet fittings while supporting the weight of the filter-drier.)
Install nuts securing evaporator inlet and outlet lines to the evaporator core inlet and outlet fittings. Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
Tighten two mounting bolts securing filter-drier to evaporator housing. Tighten to 11,000 to 11,600 N.mm (97 to 103 lbf-in).
Secure filter-drier inlet line clamp to evaporator housing using one screw.
Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect end of evaporator-to-compressor line (7, Figure 24) to outlet thermistor line (5). Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
Secure evaporator-to-compressor line to cowl using existing clamp(s).
Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect end of condenser-to-evaporator line (10, Figure 24) to filter-drier inlet fitting. Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
Secure condenser-to-evaporator line to evaporator housing (9, Figure 24) using existing clamps.
Connect wiring to thermistors (2 and 5, Figure 24) and secure wires in original position using strap locks.
Connect wiring connector to actuator motor (16, Figure 25) for fresh/recirc air door.

note.para: In the following step the actuator may also be recalibrated by disconnecting the vehicle battery for 15 seconds; however, this method may result in disrupting other electrical equipment (radio presets, etc.).

step1.para:
Recalibrate fresh/recirc air door by disconnecting HVAC control panel assembly for at least 15 seconds. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HVAC CONTROL PANEL ASSEMBLY
.
Recharge A/C system. Refer to:
If engine air cleaner and mounting bracket were removed, perform steps 21a through 21d; otherwise, proceed to step 22.

step2.para: Install engine air cleaner mounting bracket to cowl.
Install engine air cleaner on its mounting bracket.
Connect electrical connections to all components mounted on air cleaner mounting bracket.
Connect air tube and wiring to engine air cleaner housing.

step1.para: Install cab cowl tray/HVAC air inlet.
Install right side splash panel, if previously removed.
